initialize(address,address,address,strin.details: Contract follows proxy pattern and this function is used to initialize the variables for the contract in the proxy

params._admin: Admin of the verification contract who can add verifiers and remove masterAddresses deemed invalid
params._name: name of the verifier (used in domain seperator)
params._signerAddress: Address of the signer bot verifying users and signing off-chain messages
params._version: version of the verifier (used in domain seperator)

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._isMasterLinked: should master address be linked to itself

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

initialize(address,address,address,strin.notice: Initializes the variables of the contract

twitterIdMap(string).notice: stores the user address against twitterId

updateVerification(address).notice: used to update verification contract address

userData(address).notice: stores the user metadata against their address

documentation.text: @notice stores the user metadata against their address
@notice stores the user address against twitterId

@notice emitted when verification contract address is updated
 @param verification address of the updated verification contract

@notice emitted when Signer address is updated
 @param signerAddress address of the updated verification contract

@notice used to unregister self
 @dev users themselves can unregister themself

@notice used to unregister user
 @dev owners can unregister users
